awards:
North Sea 1941–45
English Channel 1942–43
Sicily 1943
Salerno 1943
Mediterranean 1943
Normandy 1944
Fate:
sold to Egypt
returned to RN control after the Nationalist Government fell.
captured by Israel on 31 October 1956 and commissioned as INS Haifa (K-38)
Scrapped in 1972
Badge: On a field Red, on a White roundel, a bugle horn stringed Black within the strings a blue rose.
Name:
Lin Fu
Mohammed Ali
INS Haifa
Propulsion:
Two x Admiralty 3 drum boilers
Two shaft Parsons geared turbines
19,000 shp
Range: 3,500 nmi (6,480 km) at 15 knots (28 km/h) / 1,000 nmi (2,000 km) at 26 knots (48 km/h)
Armament:
4 × QF 4 in Mark XVI on twin mounts Mk. XIX
4 × QF 2 pdr Mk. VIII on quad mount MK.VII
2 × 20 mm Oerlikons on single mounts P Mk. III
40 depth charges, 2 throwers, 1 rack
